entries.title: Funeral for Palestinian boy killed during Israeli raid highlights growing tensions
entries.description: Last year, 146 Palestinians were killed by Israeli forces in the West Bank and east Jerusalem, the largest number since 2004.

entries.title: Spanish police raid illegal tobacco plant accused of exploiting Ukrainian laborers
entries.description: A raid on an illegal tobacco factory in northern Spain found 10 Ukrainian laborers who were being forced to work long hours at very low salaries and without valid employment contracts, a Spanish Civil Guard officer said Monday.

entries.title: Russian mercenary commander who fled to Norway detained, but lawyer denies any plan to deport him
entries.description: Norwegian police have detained a former commander of Russia’s Wagner mercenary group who recently fled to Norway, but his lawyer dismissed suggestions that he might be deported to Russia.

entries.title: World Athletics proposes tighter rules for transgender women athletes
entries.description: World Athletics on Saturday said it is consulting with member federations on a proposal that would impose more stringent testosterone limits on transgender women athletes competing in women’s track and field events.

entries.title: U.S. and Israel launch a massive joint military exercise to send a message to Iran and others
entries.description: The U.S. and Israel began a massive joint military exercise Monday to show Iran and others the U.S. is not too distracted by Ukraine to mobilize a large force.

entries.title: Pope calls for an end to violence in Peru, urges talks
entries.description: Pope Francis on Sunday made an impassioned plea, delivered partly in Spanish, for an end to widening violence in Peru.

entries.title: Spanish police raid illegal tobacco factories accused of exploiting Ukrainian refugees
entries.description: Spanish authorities raided three illegal tobacco factories that were allegedly exploiting Ukrainian refugees, who were working in poor condition. The Spanish Guardia Civil police and Europol seized more than 3.5 million packets of untaxed tobacco from the three factories, worth almost $20 million.

entries.title: Parts of Pakistan without power as national grid suffers breakdown
entries.description: Traffic lights and computer screens went dark in throughout most of Pakistan after the country was hit by a nationwide power cut due to a major breakdown in its national grid. Pakistan’s Energy Ministry said the breakdown started early Monday and work was underway to revive the system.

entries.title: Peru closes Machu Picchu as anti-government protests grow
entries.description: Peru indefinitely shut the famed ancient ruins of Machu Picchu on Saturday in the latest sign that anti-government protests that began last month are increasingly engulfing the South American country.

entries.title: French President Macron: ‘Nothing has been ruled out’ on sending tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: During a press conference with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, French President Emmanuel Macron commented on the possibility of sending tanks to Ukraine, saying “nothing has been ruled out,” but Scholz did not comment on whether Germany would agree to provide its tanks, instead stressing what his country has already supplied.

entries.title: Poland to ask for go-ahead to send tanks to Ukraine after Germany signals shift in veto
entries.description: Poland will ask Germany for permission to send Leopard tanks to Ukraine, Polish Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki said Monday.

entries.title: Japan's leader prioritizes arms buildup, reversing low birthrate
entries.description: Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said Monday that Japan faces the severest security environment in the region since the end of World War II and pledged to push a military buildup under a newly adopted security strategy, as well as tackle rapidly declining births so the country can sustain national strength.

entries.title: Tens of millions without power after Pakistan suffers major outage
entries.description: Much of Pakistan was left without power for several hours on Monday morning as an energy-saving measure by the government backfired.

entries.title: American held in Iran ends hunger strike, urges 'tough decisions’ to free U.S. citizens
entries.description: U.S. businessman Siamak Namazi, imprisoned in Iran since 2015, ended a seven-day hunger strike and urged President Biden to make “tough decisions” to secure the release of Americans held in Tehran.
